jumbotron.title: Welcome!
jumbotron.body:
This is the personal site of Joel Detweiler. I'm a full-stack software engineer working as a contractor. This is a site to find information about me, view the projects I work on, and find blog posts that I've written. If you like what you see and want to work on a project together, reach out to me and let's talk.

I am building this site myself and including all source code in my GitHub page. All content is generated using straightforward templates, so this site could be easily forked and re-used.

resume.name: Joel Detweiler
resume.title: Full Stack Developer
resume.aboutMe: Full-stack engineer with experience working on new and growing products. I love building things from scratch, trying new languages/frameworks, and assembling existing tools to create something great. I'm an efficient and flexibile team player used to wearing many hats and taking on a variety of responsibilities. I think the power of technology lies in its potential to help people.

experience.title: Contract Software Developer
items: Ownership over all frontend development of company site using AngularJS and AWS.
Preparing site for initial release of MVP.

experience.title: Full-Stack Developer
items: Ownership over all frontend development of company site using AngularJS and AWS.
Database work using MongoDB and PostgreSQL.
Managed collection and display of key company analytics.
Implemented Selenium framework for automated site testing.

experience.title: Associate Software Engineer
items: First developer on a team working on new products for life science companies.
Wrote server-side code and RESTful APIs in Java.
Developed rich client-side UIs using Javascript, jQuery, and AngularJS.
Integrated all work with the Salesforce data platform.

experience.title: Student Intern
items: Performed original Machine Learning research with applications to computersecurity.
Used Markov Chains and Hidden Markov Models to detect anomalies in networkconnection data.

education.name: Pomona College
items: Thesis: Updatable Learning of Support Vector Machines
